physical_appearance: This is a turban cloth, which is part of a bridegroom's clothes. It features vertical multicoloured stripes on the left end of the band. The stripes are made of embroidered thread. The remaining length of the turban cloth is folded up on the left.
sgcool_label_text: This set of garments - tunic, trousers and a turban cloth - form a set of bridegroom's clothes among the Dhebaria Rabari community of east Kutch. The group features excellent cotton embroidery incorporating mirrorwork embellishments. The fabric of the trousers is handwoven Mashroo silk, while the turban cloth is made from handspun cotton.
title_text: Waist band of the Bridegroom's Dress Wagho, choyni Turban cloth of the Bridegroom's Dress
subject_terms_1: folk costume geometric motifs embroidery (visual works) cloth ceremonial costume bridegrooms
